conclusion: To determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into, we need to analyze the path of the liquid as it flows down from points A, B, and C.
Liquid flows from point A and encounters a black baffle.
The black baffle directs the liquid from point A towards the right.
The liquid from point A flows into the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from point A towards the pink container (E).
Liquid flows from point B and encounters a blue baffle.
The blue baffle directs the liquid from point B towards the right.
The liquid from point B flows into the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from point B towards the pink container (E).
Liquid flows from point C directly down, bypassing any initial baffles.
The liquid from point C encounters a pink baffle.
The pink baffle directs the liquid from point C towards the right.
The liquid from point C flows into the yellow baffle.
The yellow baffle directs the liquid from point C towards the pink container (E).
All the liquid from points A, B, and C is directed into the pink container (E) due to the arrangement of the baffles.
The liquid will flow into container E.
